chav1961.purelib.basic

Class BitCharSet

  • java.lang.Object
    • chav1961.purelib.basic.BitCharSet
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Cloneable
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    ExtendedBitCharSet

    public class BitCharSet
extends Object
implements Cloneable

    This class implements a quick restricted set of characters.

    The main aim of this class is to reduce time for typical set operations for the character sets. The class supports only restricted char set for the first 0..127 characters in the code table. Use the ExtendedBitCharSet class to operate with the whole range of available characters in the set. The class not supports a set-specific operations (union, intersect, minus)

    To reduce time for operations, the class doesn't check parameters of it's methods, but catches available exceptions during call processing. To avoid strong reducing of the performance, never use this class to work with the symbols out of 0..127 range! Use ExtendedBitCharSet class instead

    The most of all methods of the class return the BitCharSet type. It's exactly this reference, so you can use them in the chained operations (for example new BitCharSet().add('a','b','c').addRange('0','9') etc)

    Since:
    0.0.1, last change 0.0.2
    Author:
    Alexander Chernomyrdin aka chav1961
    See Also:
    ExtendedBitCharSet, JUnit tests

      • toArrayPairs

        public char[][] toArrayPairs()

        Convert the set content to the character array pairs. Every element of the array pairs is either single char array for the individual character, or two character array for the contiguous character range

        Returns:
        ordered character array pairs containing set content. Can be empty but not null
        Since:
        0.0.2
